title: Code Names (2001-present)
brief_description: Trevor Paglen’s Code Names exists as a list of words, phrases and terms that designate classified military programs. These include classified exercises and units, intelligence programs, information compartments and Pentagon “Special Access Programs.” Installed in downtown Syracuse, Code Names functions as a meditation on language and advertising whose product is foreign to the general population. The contents of the piece become metaphors for the unknown and ask the audience to ponder what exactly they mean.

constellations_other.name: Orwell & Snowden
constellations_other.description: Explores Orwell as a representation of the NSA, and the infamous Snowden leak.
